pr_title: Update Reactive Messaging to version 2.2.0 and Integrate health support

timeline.message:
Integrate health support to reactive messaging.

Also fix the durability bug when sending messages to a non-durable AMQP address

Integrate health support to reactive messaging.

Also fix the durability bug when sending messages to a non-durable AMQP address

timeline.bodyText: Is the in case... part true? AFAICS, you always drag the smallrye-health dependency.
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: It only depends on the SPI, not on the extension itself.
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText:
You sure? smallrye-reactive-messaging-health doesn't depend on health?
Because if you don't have health, I'm surprised this can work: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/10831/files#diff-0e5b3cb2b027d18a3e49591822e8c947R310 . You would need to use a string for the class name as there's a good chance you wouldn't be able to load the checks if health is not present.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: smallrye-reactive-messaging-health depends on microprofile health not on the quarkus extension.
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/10831/files#diff-0e5b3cb2b027d18a3e49591822e8c947R310 refers to classes from reactive messaging (in a specific module that depends on microprofile health).
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: I just re-tested it does not pull quarkus-health, it's up to the user to use it.
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: We discussed this with @cescoffier on Zulip. Let's merge as is even if not entirely consistent with the other SmallRye extensions.
replies.author: gsmet
